moves.1. e4: Meyer indicates he wants an open game, quickly tactical.
moves.2. Bc4: An old-fashiooned variant. 2 N-KB3 supplanted this move in popularity around 1830.
moves.2... Bc5: Countering symmetrically. 2... N-KB3 is the most solid response, but this move is acceptable.
moves.3. Qh5: If properly defensed, this move should not be a threat. But Newcomb fails to properly defense it.
moves.3... g6: An error. The correct move was 3... N-KR3, to be followed up with 4... O-O neutralizing any chance of a quick mate and leaving White's Q dangerously exposed.
moves.4. Qxe5+: Meyer pounces on the mistake. Black's position is already crumbling.
moves.4... Ne7: The alternatives aren't much better. There's no way to avoid losing the KR.
moves.5. Qxh8+: The King-hunt is on in earnest.
moves.6... Bf8: 6... K-K2 would have prolonged the game, but Newcomb's position was hopeless anyway.
moves.7. Qxf7#: Mercifully putting Black out of his misery.
